page.title: 04The Community Of Nantwich.
page.content: Cheshire County Council and Crewe and Nantwich Council provide {employment}in various categories,e.g. library,parks and ground maintenance. Several homes for the elderly and a geriatric hospital are staffed mainly by women.The five Primary and two Comprehensive schools employing 300 staff approximately,professional and ancillary,and a swimming and leisure complex with full and part-time staff of 16.The General Post Office, with a staff of 40,predominately male. The{Beam Heath Trust:}householders in Nantwich are still,as in Saxon times,owners of 400 acres of common land.It is administered by a body known as the Beam Heath Trust.The income from these lands is shared annually,giving rise to the local joke {"Nantwich is a town you are paid to {live in!"
